intro: Psychotria alemquerensis, commonly known as the Alemquer psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
